caption.title: Re-plot of S6 Fig where we adapt our sea-level rise estimates to account for future changes in water stored behind dams and in reservoirs.
caption.p: The maps of Oakland, CA display the baseline 100-yr flood risk area in yellow. In the year 2100, the potential 100-yr flood height includes the addition of sea-level projections. The future 100-yr flood risk area based on the mean sea-level projection is in orange, based on the Heberger et al. [ 7] sea-level projection in red, and based on accounting for sea-level rise uncertainty is in dark red. The location of the tide gauge is displayed as a star. However, in this figure we account for changes in land water storage in the year 2100 by adding roughly 0.55 m to the sea-level estimates [ 7].
Click here for additional data file.
